intro: Cryphiantha, commonly known as the silverleaf creeper, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in clusters. Cryphiantha thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and ability to cover walls or trellises.
